title: Shawl, 19th century
description:
Pattern: Taupe center of eight-pointed star on red ground filled with highly sylized florals and plants in shades of red, pink, orange, green, blue, purple,and white. From each corner pointing toward the center emerges a bouquet of flowers defined within a yellow pine-cone shape set on an elaborate vase.
Construction: The rectangular center field is woven in nine pieces (one piece for the center star shape and eight pieces with seams that bisect each of the eight pine-cone shapes.). The inner border is composed of four long woven strips seamed along the four edges. The outer border is composed of narrow strips of rectangles of various colors seamed together and embroidered.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shawl, 19th century.
19th century. Medium:
Technique: twill tapestry, embroidery. Bequest of Dorothy Franklin Rolph. 1980-38-1.
